intro: Boerhavia adscendens, commonly known as the redroot sandplum, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils. The plant features slender, ascending stems and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive reddish tint, especially when exposed to full sun. Boerhavia adscendens is known for its adaptability to arid conditions and is often found in coastal or desert environments.
